intro: Farsetia occidentalis, commonly known as the western farsetia, is a flowering plant native to the western regions of the United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Farsetia occidentalis typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its ornamental value lies in its delicate foliage and subtle floral display.
